definitions.definition: The portion of an instrument landing system which provides vertical guidance to an aircraft during an approach to landing .

subdefinitions.definition: The vertical descent profile produced by the ILS glideslope transmitters.
examples: Staying on the glideslope is vitally important for a safe, stabilized approach and landing.

definitions.definition: The approach path of an aircraft as it comes in to land .

main_definition: ( aviation ) The portion of an instrument landing system which provides vertical guidance to an aircraft during an approach to landing .
secondary_definitions: ( aviation ) The approach path of an aircraft as it comes in to land .
